thread.title: Downtown Albany adds more free parking options to attract workers, visitors after 5 p.m.
thread.title_full: Downtown Albany adds more free parking options to attract workers, visitors after 5 p.m.

author: Megan Rogers
title: Downtown Albany adds more free parking options to attract workers, visitors after 5 p.m.
text:
Donna Abbott-Vlahos | Albany Business Review Free parking is available on the street within the Downtown Albany Business Improvementâ€¦ more More free parking is now available in downtown Albany, a move designed to make it easier for visitors and workers to stay in the city. Free parking is available on the street within the Downtown Albany Business Improvement District and in three Albany Parking Authority-owned garages on weeknights and weekends, starting today. The goal is to attract visitors and make it easier for workers to eat, shop or socialize in downtown Albany after 5 p.m. "It's trying to make downtown more accessible and friendly to people, so they'll want to come downtown and not be concerned about getting parking tickets and getting their car towed," said Brad Rosenstein , owner of Jack's Oyster House, a fine-dining restaurant on State Street. Rosenstein is also the board chairman of the Downtown Albany Business Improvement District. The parking initiative is a collaboration of Albany Parking Authority and the Downtown Albany BID. Among the changes announced today: 420 parking meters on streets within the Downtown Albany BID are free beginning at 5 p.m. Monday through Friday. Previously, parking was free starting at 6 p.m. Parking at three garages owned by the Albany Parking Authority is free from 5 p.m. to midnight on weeknights. Previously, it cost $2 to park, beginning at 6 p.m. Riverfront Garage is free to park at during the weekend. In October, the Green-Hudson Garage will offer free parking during weekends. Currently, the Green-Hudson Garage and the Quackenbush Garage are not open on weekends.
